+
A '''SIM lock''', '''Simlock''' or '''Network lock''', not to be confused with [[Personal identification number|PIN]] or [[Personal Unblocking Code|PUK]] code, is a capability built-in to [[GSM]] phones by [[mobile phone]] manufacturers. Network providers use this capability to restrict the use of these phones to specific countries and network providers. Currently, phones can be locked to accept only [[Subscriber Identity Module|SIM]] cards from one or more of the following:
* Countries (the phone will work in one country, but not another)
* Countries (the phone will work in one country, but not another)
